description: Uncertainty associated with the statistical representativeness of the chosen historical and/or site data period.
Uncertainty associated with the accuracy or reliability of the chosen reference data source.
Uncertainty associated with the MCP process, including statistical or empirical uncertainty in establishing a correlation or making a prediction.
Uncertainty associated with the representativeness of the measured or predicted wind speed distribution.
Uncertainty associated with gap-filling missing data periods, usually done using directional correlations or the measure-correlate-predict process.
Uncertainty including effects from wind speed sensor characteristics, mounting or deployment, and data handling and processing.

Uncertainty associated with interannual variability of wind speed data, climate change, and plant performance. Adjust accordingly for an N-year horizon. Usually, the longer the period, the lower the inherent variability.
Uncertainty associated with sensor type or quality, operational characteristics, and mounting effects for wind speed.
Uncertainty associated with sensor type or quality, operational characteristics, and mounting effects for wind direction.
Uncertainty associated with temperature, pressure, humidity, and air density measurements.
Uncertainty associated with documentation, verification, and traceability of the data.
Uncertainty associated with model sensitivity to terrain data, roughness, forestry information, and atmospheric conditions.
Uncertainty associated with the representativeness of initiation points relative to turbine locations, considering complicating factors (e.g., forestry, stability, steep slopes, elevation, veer).
Uncertainty associated with the scientific plausibility of the model to capture complicating factors.
Uncertainty associated with large extrapolation distance, terrain surface characterization, wind data measurement heights, and complex terrain.
Uncertainty associated with the propagation of measurement uncertainty from wind speed and direction measurements to the extrapolated wind speed at turbine hub height.
Uncertainty associated with the model appropriateness and sensitivity used to characterize wake, blockage, and turbine interaction effects.
Uncertainty associated with the turbine availability losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with the balance of plant losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with the grid availability losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with the electrical efficiency losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with the parasitic consumption losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with the turbine sub-optimal performance losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with generic power curve adjustment losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with site-specific power curve adjustment losses estimate (e.g., air density corrected power curve).
Uncertainty associated with high wind hysteresis losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with icing losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with degradation losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with environmental losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with exposure changes losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with load curtailment losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with grid curtailment losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with environmental curtailment losses estimate.
Uncertainty associated with operational strategy losses estimate (such as sector management).
